lines.text: You speak Yiddish?
No, but I can read the subtitles.
You really are incredibly stupid, aren't you? I like that in a man.

[after having been shown Lana's elaborate plan to kill Ned]
You've been thinking about this for a long time, haven't you, baby?
No... It just came to me.
So, I hear you go both ways.

[surprised]
Only once. It was a fraternity prank. I never saw him again.
No, I mean you're a cop and a lawyer.
Lot of scum out there on the streets. They all deserve a fair and costly trial.
What can I do for you?
I've run across some papers. And I thought you might be able to tell me what they are. You see, I'm not very experienced when it comes to papers.
Well I'll help you, Miss Cain, if I'm Abel.

[leaving a playground]
I love recess.
[questioning his own wife on the witness stand]
Now, Mrs. Ravine... may I call you Lana?
Oh, please, call me Angel Tits.
I object!
Sustained. Counselor, you will address Angel Tits as Mrs. Ravine.
How does the jury find the defendant on the count of murder?
Not guilty.
On the count of conspiracy?
Not guilty.
On the Count of Monte Cristo?
Not guilty.
Put the can back in American! The Jew back in jurisprudence! The con back in constitution! And the dumb back in freedom!
What are you gonna do? Blow me away?
He left me. He left me because she looked more like me than I did.
[Ned reads a business card left on Laura's desk. The card smokes]
30. Lola. 5810 Fountain Avenue, Los Angeles, California 90028. 213-555-5555.

[thinks]
Hmmmm.
I forgot my keys.
That's not why you came back!

[puzzled]
... Yes it is.
No... You came back for *this*!
[jumps on Ned Ravine, throwing him to the floor and ripping his pants off]
Oh, this is so different!

[to Lola Cain]
You stay away from my wife, my life, my home, and my skunk!
I'm gonna put these two fingers in his eyes, this finger in his mouth, and use his head for a friggin' bowling ball!
Are you a good bowler Mr. Shady?
How would you handle a 7-10 split?

[turns bathtub tap on and off and notices that background music responds to the same action]
... I need an aspirin.

[Laura is having a flashback]
No! No! No!
[she is splashed by a gallon of water]
Laura! Snap out of it!
[he stands holding a tiny dixie cup]
You're the first man who has lasted that long on that barstool.
I'm flattered.
Well, don't. It's broken.
[the stool collapses]
Mr. Ravine, how does it feel to have slept with a murderess?
It's better than sleeping with a Ninja Turtle.

[in court]
Miss Lincolnberry, can you tell us what this is?
Yes, that is one of the many death threats that Max Shady faxed to you the day that he was released from prison.
A fax... in which he threatened to purée... certain parts of my anatomy... in a blender.
I object! There's no need to deal with the facts in this case.
I'll allow it.
[to his wife, who has just met Lola Cain]
I have never seen this woman in my life. I never followed her home. I never had sex with her in her refrigerator. This is a sick fantasy, and I deny everything.

[to Lola]
And WHEN will women like YOU learn you CAN'T tear apart a perfectly good marriage with your vicious lies?

[thinking]
I wonder what he's thinking when he looks at me with that goofy smile.

[thinking]
Boy, does she look stupid in that hat.

[thinking]
If I told him how I really feel, he'd probably fire me. Oh, what am I saying? He probably doesn't even know I exist.

[thinking]
Laura's incredible. And so smart. I wonder if she's smart enough to know that that was Lola's lipstick on my collar? And that we spent the night bumping ugly and knocking boots?

[thinking]
Maybe I should dress more like Lola Cain. Then he'd notice me. Hm. If I came in wearing no panties, no bra and a wet T-shirt, then...

[interrupting her thinking]
Maybe she hasn't found the right... Oh, I'm sorry.

[thinking]
I was just rambling.

[thinking]
Go ahead.

[thinking]
No, no, really. You first.

[thinking]
No, I insist, please.
